did.abstract: This collection contains the correspondence and patents pertaining to a number of Charles Adler Jr.'s inventions, including aircraft lights, horns, and proximity lights.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection is made up of three folders containing the papers related to patents of Charles Adler Jr ranging from 1936 to 1952. There are letters, sketches, as well as patents for aircraft lights, proximity lights, and safety horns.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Charles Adler Jr. was an inventor and engineer born in 1899 in Baltimore, Maryland. He attended John Hopkins University and briefly joined the army. Later he joined the Maryland and Pennsylvania Railroad developing safety devices. In 1928 he designed the first audible traffic horn. He was granted over 60 patents in his lifetime, 10 of which he donated to the government. He was a member of the Maryland State Aviation Commission and the Maryland Traffic Safety Commission.
